# Discord Chat Analysis

## 1. Summary
The chat segment is brief and contains minimal technical discussion. There's a mention of a Twitter post about lights, which prompted a brief technical comment from ash about shader optimization for lights. The discussion notes that developers have been "priming shaders with a maximum number of lights" as a workaround, and this approach is now officially supported. There's also a short exchange where jin considers naming conventions for a GitHub repository, initially suggesting "apps" versus "hyperfy-apps", but ultimately decides that "hyperfy-apps" might be more discoverable when cloning.

## 2. FAQ
Q: Can we have lights now? (asked by jin) A: Unanswered directly, though ash later commented on light implementation techniques.

## 3. Help Interactions

Documentation: Consider documenting repository naming conventions for better discoverability | Description: Using "hyperfy-apps" instead of generic "apps" for better recognition when cloning | Mentioned By: jin

JL from ChainPatrol inquires if the team will be attending EthDenver, mentioning that ChainPatrol has a booth (Booth N) and offering to set up a Telegram group to facilitate connections.
